t: God*pn has taken his place in the divine council; in*ld the midst of the gods he holds judgment:
“How*ln long will you judge unjustly and*ld show partiality to the wicked? Selah*ig
Give*ln justice to the weak and the fatherless; maintain*ld the right of the afflicted and the destitute.
Rescue*ln the weak and the needy; deliver*ld them from the hand of the wicked.”
They*pn have neither knowledge nor understanding, they*ld walk about in darkness; all*ld the foundations of the earth are shaken.
I*pn said, “You are gods, sons*ld of the Most High, all of you;
nevertheless,*ln like men you shall die, and*ld fall like any prince.”
Arise,*pn O God, judge the earth; for*ld you shall inherit all the nations!
